definition: to store up/to grow (e.g. a beard)/to entertain (ideas)

sentences.english: And actually, of this enterprise buythestrategy already" premeditate long already".
sentences.chinese: 而其實，該企業的併購戰略早已“蓄謀已久”。

sentences.english: She deliberately set out to poison her husband.
The player committed an intentional foul.
sentences.chinese: 那名球員是蓄謀犯規的。

sentences.english: The long-awaited international renunciation of the dollar has begun.
sentences.chinese: 蓄謀已久的世界拋棄美元的行動開始了。

sentences.english: Kaufmann said it was not clear if it was an accident or an aimed hit.
sentences.chinese: 考夫曼稱這是意外還是蓄謀則不得而知。

sentences.english: Indeed, there was almost an element of choreography in the strike.
sentences.chinese: 的確，這次罷工似乎蓄謀已久。

sentences.english: The group decided to commit several acts of deliberate violence.
sentences.chinese: 這隊人決定實施幾起蓄謀已久的事。

sentences.english: They are plotting to overthrow the government.
